data.title: Choose the correct answer for each question

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Inversion after negative adverbials.
sections.explain: Fronted adverbial: Never. Verb: have I seen. Object: such chaos.

words.word: Never have I seen such chaos.
I never have seen such chaos.
Never I have seen such chaos.

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Cleft sentence for emphasis.
sections.explain: Cleft structure: It was her kindness. Relative clause: that impressed me.

words.word: It was her kindness that impressed me.
Her kindness was it that impressed me.
It that impressed me was her kindness.

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Mixed conditional (past condition + present result).
sections.explain: If-clause: If I had taken the job. Main clause: I would be living in Paris now.

words.word: If I had taken the job, I would be living in Paris now.
If I would have taken the job, I would live in Paris now.
If I took the job, I would have been living in Paris.

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Participle clause for cause.
sections.explain: Participle clause: Being tired. Main clause: he went to bed early.

words.word: Being tired, he went to bed early.
He being tired went to bed early.
He went being tired to bed early.

sections.explain: Fronted object: This issue. Verb: I want to discuss.

words.word: This issue, I want to discuss.
I want to this issue discuss.
Discuss I want this issue.

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Modal verbs in the past (deduction).
sections.explain: Subject: She. Modal: must have forgotten. Object: the meeting.

words.word: She must have forgotten the meeting.
She must has forgotten the meeting.
She must forgot the meeting.

sections.explain: Expression: It is essential that. Clause: he be on time.

words.word: It is essential that he be on time.
It is essential that he is on time.
It is essential he to be on time.

sections.explain: Structure: I had my car repaired. Passive causative for service performed by someone else.

words.word: I had my car repaired.
I have repaired my car.
I got repaired my car.

sections.summary: Teaching Focus: Defining relative clause with preposition.
sections.explain: Clause: The man to whom I spoke. Verb: was very polite.

words.word: The man to whom I spoke was very polite.
The man whom I spoke to was very polite.
The man who I spoke was very polite.

sections.explain: Emphasis: I do appreciate. Object: your support.

words.word: I do appreciate your support.
Do I appreciate your support.
I appreciate do your support.
